seo.title: Path of the Gods from Hostel Brikette
seo.description: Exact route from the hostel to the Sentiero degli Dei trailheads, with transit options and safety tips.

linkLabel: Path of the Gods: Complete Guide from Positano
intro: The Sentiero degli Dei (Path of the Gods) strings together cliff-top terraces, chestnut groves, and sweeping views across the Amalfi Coast. From Hostel Brikette you can reach the trail by combining local ferries and SITA buses without joining a pricey tour.

Three main approaches start from the hostel: sailing to Amalfi and bussing up to Bomerano, riding the bus network the whole way, or skipping the transfers and hiking an out-and-back from Nocelle. Use this overview to decide which detailed route suits your time, budget, and comfort with heights.

sections.title: Highlights at a glance
body: Panoramic balconies float above Positano, Praiano, and Capri, so even short sections reward you with dramatic photo stops.
The gradients are steady rather than technical; confident walkers can tackle the path with good footwear and plenty of water.
Public transport keeps costs low compared with private drivers or guided excursions, letting you splurge on post-hike treats instead.

sections.title: Before you commit
body: Expect exposed ledges, handrail-free staircases, and long drops. Anyone with vertigo should favour the gentler Nocelle out-and-back.
Door-to-door journeys take 3–5 hours depending on your route. Summer heat makes early starts or late afternoon departures essential.

sections.title: Route options from Hostel Brikette
body: [Ferry via Amalfi guide](guide:pathOfTheGodsFerry): walk to Spiaggia Grande, sail to Amalfi, bus uphill to Bomerano, hike to Nocelle, and ride the shuttle back. Longest day but pairs sea views with time in Amalfi.

[Bus via Amalfi guide](guide:pathOfTheGodsBus): buy tickets at Bar Internazionale, take the SITA bus to Amalfi, connect to the Agerola service, then follow the classic Bomerano → Nocelle traverse. Best when seas are rough or ferries are sold out.

[Direct Nocelle loop guide](guide:pathOfTheGodsNocelle): catch the Montepertuso–Nocelle minibus, walk the panoramic out-and-back toward Colle Serra, and return on the same bus. Ideal for a lighter day or to avoid tight transfers.

sections.title: Trail basics
body: The Sentiero degli Dei links Bomerano and Nocelle over roughly 6 kilometres of undulating path with about 200 metres of elevation change.
Waymarks show red-and-white CAI stripes plus wooden "Sentiero" arrows. Surfaces alternate between cobbled steps, packed dirt, and rocky ledges—pack grippy shoes and keep your hands free.

sections.title: Planning tips
body: Check the forecast the night before; rain makes the stone steps slick and strong winds can halt ferries.
Carry at least 1.5 litres of water per person. Refills are limited to cafés in Bomerano, kiosks in Nocelle, and the occasional farmhouse stand.
Validate SITA bus tickets before boarding and keep a spare ticket in your daypack for unexpected detours.

essentials: Comfortable footwear with grip plus sun protection and layers for exposed ridgelines.
Pre-purchased SITA bus tickets (tabacchi or Bar Internazionale) for every leg you plan to ride.
Offline maps or saved directions in case mobile data drops in the ravines.
typicalCosts: SITA bus Positano ⇄ Amalfi/Bomerano/Nocelle: €2–€4 per leg depending on ticket type.
Travelmar or Lucibello ferry Positano ⇄ Amalfi: roughly €12–€16 each way in peak season.
Trail snacks and water from village shops: €3–€8; access to the path itself is free.
tips: Leave before 09:00 in July–August or aim for the golden hours in spring and autumn for cooler temperatures and softer light.
Avoid the 1,700-step descent to Positano unless your knees are fresh—descending Montepertuso stairs after a long hike is brutal.
Use a lightweight daypack and keep trekking poles folded until you reach steeper staircases.

steps.name: Pick your route
steps.text: Choose between the ferry via Amalfi, bus via Amalfi, or direct Nocelle option based on weather, ferry schedules, and energy levels.

steps.name: Secure transport tickets
steps.text: Buy SITA bus tickets at Bar Internazionale and ferry tickets at the harbour if you plan to sail.

steps.name: Travel to the trailhead
steps.text: Ride to Bomerano for the full traverse or to Nocelle for the shorter out-and-back section.

steps.name: Hike Sentiero degli Dei
steps.text: Follow CAI markers between panoramic terraces, pacing yourself for photo and snack stops.

steps.name: Return to Positano
steps.text: Catch the bus back to Chiesa Nuova or walk only if you intentionally want the long stair descent.

faq.q: How long does the hike take door to door?
faq.a: Budget 3–5 hours including transport. The ferry route is the longest; the Nocelle out-and-back fits into a half day.

faq.q: Is the trail suitable for beginners?
faq.a: Yes, provided you are steady on your feet and comfortable with heights. There are no technical climbs, just steady ascents and descents.

faq.q: What happens if ferries are cancelled?
faq.a: Switch to the bus via Amalfi or ride directly to Nocelle. Always keep a spare bus ticket so you can adapt to sea or weather conditions.
